block.p: Millie-Marie Dell, the daughter of Kate and Christopher Dell of Richmond, N.H., was married yesterday to Steven Edward Bosak, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Barry F. Bosak of Briarcliff, N.Y. The Rev. Carol L. Karlson, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at the Cathedral of the Pines in Rindge, N.H.

The bride, who is 26 and is known as Mia, is a staff lawyer in the South Bronx office of Bronx Legal Services. Ms. Dell, who is keeping her name, graduated from Earlham College in Richmond, Ind., and received a law degree from New York Law School. Her father, a writer and historian, retired as a social-science analyst for the Congressional Research Service of the Library of Congress in Washington. Next month, the bride's mother is to become the middle-school librarian for Holton Arms Academy, a private school in Bethesda, Md.

Millie-Marie Dell, the daughter of Kate and Christopher Dell of Richmond, N.H., was married yesterday to Steven Edward Bosak, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Barry F. Bosak of Briarcliff, N.Y. The Rev. Carol L. Karlson, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at the Cathedral of the Pines in Rindge, N.H.

The bride, who is 26 and is known as Mia, is a staff lawyer in the South Bronx office of Bronx Legal Services. Ms. Dell, who is keeping her name, graduated from Earlham College in Richmond, Ind., and received a law degree from New York Law School. Her father, a writer and historian, retired as a social-science analyst for the Congressional Research Service of the Library of Congress in Washington. Next month, the bride's mother is to become the middle-school librarian for Holton Arms Academy, a private school in Bethesda, Md.

The bridegroom, 29, is the corporate relations associate for the National Audubon Society in New York. He graduated from Colgate University, and next month, he is to enter the master's degree program in environmental studies at the Yale University School of Forestry. His father is a managing director in the research division of Smith Barney, the securities brokerage company in New York.
